page.title: 12NARROW GAUGE RAILWAY
page.content: The Ravenglass and Eskdale Railway Co. Ltd.runs its narrow-gauge(15")trains 7 miles up Eskdale to Boot station stopping at Muncaster Mill,Irton Rd. and Green Road every working day.From March to November the open and covered carriages are pulled by the steam locomotives River Mite,River Esk River Irt,Synolda,Northern Rock and Bonnie Dundee.Diesel engines,Quarryman Silver Jubilee,Shelagh of Eskdale,Perkins and Lady Wakefield, pull extra trains if necessary and run the winter service. Most of the line is single track and there is a unique 'walkie-talkie' system to stop two trains being on the same piece of track at the same time.6 of the 7 miles of track have been replaced since 1970 when the present company bought the railway at auction. 1985 was a good year,125000 people made 190000 journeys.
